title: Grading 30-plus NBA deals, including Damian Lillard's Portland reunion
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Blazers bringing back franchise icon Damian Lillard.

title: Howell resigns as executive director of NFLPA
content: Lloyd Howell Jr. has resigned as executive director of the NFL Players Association, citing distractions his leadership has caused in recent weeks.

title: Sources: Lillard reaches deal to return to Blazers
content: Nine-time NBA All-Star Damian Lillard agreed to a three-year, $42 million contract to return to the Trail Blazers, sources told ESPN on Thursday.

title: Sources: Steelers make Watt highest-paid non-QB
content: T.J. Watt and the Steelers have agreed to a three-year, $123 million extension that again makes him the highest-paid non-quarterback in NFL history.

title: McIlroy rebounds at Portrush, in mix following 70
content: Six years after recording a quadruple-bogey 8 on No. 1 at Royal Portrush, Rory McIlroy carded a bogey-5 en route to a 1-under 70 that left him right in the mix at the Open. "I didn't feel like I was walking into the unknown this time around," he said.

title: Turnout high, but WNBA CBA talks stall in Indy
content: The first in-person meeting between the league and union since December lasted for a couple of hours and ended with no resolution on the CBA.

title: Chargers WR Williams retires, ends 8-year career
content: Chargers wide receiver Mike Williams is retiring from the NFL after eight seasons, with a source saying the decision surprised the team.

title: Trump mulls EO on athletes' employment status
content: President Donald Trump is considering an executive order that would require federal authorities to clarify whether college athletes can be considered employees of their schools.

title: Stratospheric skydiver Baumgartner dies in crash
content: Extreme athlete Felix Baumgartner, the first skydiver to fall faster than the speed of sound, in a leap through the stratosphere, has died in a paraglider crash. He was 56.

title: üíó Klay, Megan Thee Stallion on the red carpet
content: The NBA star and Grammy Award-winning rapper made their red carpet debut at her inaugural Pete & Thomas Foundation Gala.

title: 'You've got to thread it': Why hole No. 1 is playing a big part in this year's Open Championship
content: Playing the first hole at Royal Portrush well or poorly could determine who hoists the Claret Jug on Sunday.

title: 'We couldn't chance it': Why the Suns and Bradley Beal finally came to terms
content: One element of the Suns' roster failure has loomed: How to end their marriage to the three-time All-Star.

title: WNBA players, coaches voice frustration over how games are called
content: Players, coaches and fans say they want greater consistency regarding how games are refereed and the level of physicality allowed.

title: Hannah Hampton is the difference in bizarre shootout, but England needed super-subs
content: England started badly vs. Sweden, turned things around in 103 second-half seconds, then won a penalty shootout which saw nine misses to progress to the Euro 2025 semifinals. But they have their goalkeeper and two super-subs to thank.

title: The top 10 cornerbacks ahead of 2025 NFL season: Who is ranked after Pat Surtain II?
content: Who are the best cornerbacks in the NFL? We asked execs, coaches and scouts from around the league to rank their top 10.

title: 14 players who could be picked No. 1 in the 2026 NFL draft
content: Which quarterback could go first overall? What about edge rusher T.J. Parker or another non-QB? Let's project the race.

title: How Bo Jackson on a bicycle united Alabama after a record-breaking storm
content: The GOAT created a bike ride to help tornado-damaged Alabama. No one knew what it'd do -- or how it'd end.

title: Ranking the top 25 college football recruits regardless of class
content: Why let rising seniors get all the glory? We break down the best prospects in the country, including underclassmen.

title: The 10 MLB trends that ruled the first half -- and whether they'll continue
content: From chaos in the AL East to emerging young sluggers, we break down the season's biggest themes and what we should expect down the stretch run.

title: Updated top 10 prospect rankings for all 30 MLB teams -- with 2025 draft picks included!
content: Who is rising and falling in every major league farm system after the MLB draft? Kiley McDaniel digs in.

title: 'Sad.' 'Embarrassing.' Why players were a no-show at the MLB draft
content: Moving the draft to All-Star week was supposed to give it some sizzle. But not one player was in attendance.

title: Shohei Ohtani announces children's book: 'Decoy Saves Opening Day'
content: The Los Angeles Dodgers star co-authored the 32-page book with Michael Blank and it is set to release next February.

title: Weah to Marseille, Reyna to anywhere but Dortmund? Best transfer fits for USMNT stars
content: The World Cup is just one year away, so what moves, if any, should these eight USMNT players make to ensure they'll be in top form next summer?

title: Sources: Man Utd increase Mbeumo bid to $94M
content: Manchester United have increased their bid for Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo, sources have told ESPN.

title: Sources: Thiago to return to Flick's Bar√ßa staff
content: Barcelona expect to close a deal for Thiago Alcantara to return to the club as part of coach Hansi Flick's staff in the coming weeks, various sources have told ESPN.

title: Pepi 'very close' to return, embracing No. 9 jersey
content: PSV Eindhoven and USMNT striker Ricardo Pepi revealed he's "very close" to a return to the pitch after suffering a knee injury in January.

title: Modric to new club Milan: 'Average' not acceptable
content: New signing Luka Modric made clear he won't stand for the mediocrity that AC Milan displayed last season for an eighth-placed finish in Serie A.

title: Sources: Liverpool advancing in talks over Ekitike
content: Liverpool are progressing in talks to sign striker Hugo Ekitike from Eintracht Frankfurt, sources told ESPN.

title: Argentina to allow away fans after 12-year ban
content: Argentine football clubs can now welcome away supporters after a 12-year ban, the Argentine Football Association said on Thursday.

title: KC Current aim to host WC team in new facilities
content: The Kansas City Current broke ground on more real estate expansion, bringing their investment in soccer facilities to between $225 million and $250 million.

title: How Spain's quiet superstar, Mariona Caldentey, stepped out of the shadows
content: For much of Mariona Caldentey's career she operated in the shadows, but the decision to swap Barcelona for Arsenal has thrust her into the spotlight.

title: Bradley: What it's like boxing Pacquiao, and how he can beat Barrios
content: Timothy Bradley Jr. shares his thoughts about fighting Manny Pacquiao and breaks down Saturday's fight.

title: How to approach potential Rashee Rice suspension
content: Rashee Rice is likely to face a lengthy suspension in 2025, here's what fantasy managers should do right now to prepare.

title: From Chase to London, ranking the most reliable TD scorers among WRs
content: A deep dive into the most trustworthy TD scorers among wideouts based on target data, efficiency and more.

title: Ranking MLS' 2025 third kits: Who hits, misses on retro vibes?
content: Eleven teams in MLS have third kits in 2025, and ESPN ranks each throwback-inspired shirt from worst to first.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea to move for Villa's Rogers
content: Chelsea have made Aston Villa winger Morgan Rogers their top priority this summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'Zero tolerance for terror': India hails US move on Lashkar proxy TRF; EAM calls it strong coordination
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar lauded the U.S. for designating The Resistance Front (TRF) as a Foreign Terrorist Organization and Specially Designated Global Terrorist. TRF, a Lashkar-e-Taiba proxy, claimed responsibility for the deadly Pahalgam attack in Jammu and Kashmir, which killed 26 civilians.

title: Trump threatens to sue WSJ over 'birthday' note to Epstein; what did the letter say?
content: A birthday album made for Jeffrey Epstein's 50th birthday, featuring a controversial letter purportedly signed by Donald Trump, has resurfaced. The letter includes a suggestive drawing and text, which Trump vehemently denies creating, threatening a lawsuit against The Wall Street Journal. US vice president JD Vance has criticized the report.

title: Bomb scare: 20 Delhi schools receive threat emails; search under way
content: Two schools in New Delhi, Abhinav Public School in Rohini Sector 3 and Richmondd Global School in Paschim Vihar, were targeted with bomb threats on Friday, prompting immediate responses from authorities.

title: IND vs ENG: Are Jasprit Bumrah, Rishabh Pant fit for 4th Test? Injury concerns in squad
content: India face crucial decisions regarding Jasprit Bumrah and Rishabh Pant's fitness for the pivotal fourth Test against England, with the series at 2-1 in favour of the hosts. At the optional practice session, assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate provided an update on their fitness while also revealing another injury in the camp.

title: Siddaramaiah slap gesture row: Cop who sought VRS posted as Belagavi DCP
content: Narayan Baramani, the police officer involved in a controversial incident with Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, has been appointed as DCP of Belagavi city. Baramani had sought voluntary retirement following the alleged 'slap gesture' during a Congress rally. He later withdrew his request after discussions with the CM and Home Minister.

title: Musk‚Äôs reaction to Astronomer CEO apology‚Äô after Coldplay ‚Äòkiss cam‚Äô scandal
content: A video of Astronomer CEO Andy Byron and HR head Kristin Cabot kissing at a Coldplay concert has gone viral, sparking online chatter dubbed "Coldplaygate." The incident, captured on a kiss cam, led to speculation about workplace relationships. Elon Musk reacted to a morphed apology tweet with a laughing emoji, further fueling the controversy.

title: 'No trip scheduled': White House denies Trump's Pakistan trip; local media retracts report
content: The White House has refuted reports of a planned visit by President Trump to Pakistan in September. Trump is scheduled to visit Scotland from July 25-29, meeting with Prime Minister Starmer to advance trade discussions.

title: Chhattisgarh: ED raids former CM Bhupesh Baghel's Bhilai home
content: Enforcement Directorate officials conducted a search at the Bhilai residence of former Chief Minister and senior Congress leader Bhupesh Baghel on Friday morning. The ED team, accompanied by CRPF personnel, arrived in three cars. Baghel's office, through his X handle, alleged the action was intended to suppress the raising of the Tamnar tree cutting issue.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for July 18; check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests a positive outlook for the Nifty and Bank Nifty, anticipating potential uptrends with key support levels identified. UPL and Varun Beverages are highlighted as top stock picks, with buy ranges specified based on technical analysis indicating potential breakouts and upward movement in the coming months.

title: Sorry for wife, but glad: Astronomer CEO‚Äôs wife‚Äôs post viral after he's caught cheating
content: A Coldplay concert's 'Kiss Cam' captured Astronomer CEO Andy Byron in an embrace with Kristin Cabot, the company's Chief People Officer, sparking a viral sensation and intense scrutiny. The incident has drawn Byron's wife, Megan Kerrigan Byron, into the public eye, with her online profiles reflecting potential marital discord.

title: Illegal content on X endangers democracy, says govt in HC; argues 'safe harbour' not absolute right
content: The Centre has informed the Karnataka High Court that unchecked unlawful content on social media threatens democracy. It accused X of evading accountability under the IT Act's 'safe harbour' provision, arguing this protection isn't absolute but depends on responsible conduct. The government emphasized that social media platforms have a responsibility to regulate content due to their ability to amplify information.

title: Rs 1,700 crore: Hidden cost of sending money abroad
content: Indian families sending money abroad for their children's education faced high bank fees. A report estimates they paid Rs 1,700 crore in 2024. Traditional banks charge high exchange rate markups. Digital remittances offer a cheaper alternative. India is now the largest source of international students in the US. Overseas education spending is expected to double by 2030.

title: ‚ÄòCrypto-Christians‚Äô misusing caste benefits to face action: CM Fadnavis
content: Maharashtra government will take legal action against individuals identified as 'Crypto-Christians'. These individuals allegedly misuse their Hindu and reserved caste status. They secure educational, employment, and electoral benefits. Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis addressed the legislative council on this serious issue. The government is also considering an anti-conversion bill. However, voluntary religious conversions will not be banned.

title: JP Morgan CEO Jamie Dimon sends message to Trump at earnings call
content: Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan Chase's CEO, cautioned President Trump on the risks of tariffs to the US economy during the bank's earnings call. He stressed the importance of the Federal Reserve's independence, a stance contrasting with Trump's criticism of Fed Chair Jerome Powell. Despite JPMorgan's strong profits, Dimon highlighted macroeconomic risks stemming from political decisions.

title: SIR in Bihar: 89.9% voters submit forms; 5.8% yet to comply before July 25
content: With the deadline approaching, Bihar's electoral roll revision sees significant progress as 89.7% of enumeration forms submitted. The Election Commission will share details of electors not found at their addresses with political parties for verification. Efforts are underway to include temporary migrants and consider additional documents like Aadhaar for the special summary revision.

title: ‚ÄòKilled‚Äô by Meta, CM Siddaramaiah asks tech company to stop translations
content: Meta's auto-translation tool incorrectly translated a condolence message, announcing the death of Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah. Enraged by the inaccurate translation, which referred to him as "late," Siddaramaiah demanded Meta suspend the Kannada auto-translation feature. He emphasized the potential harm to public understanding and trust caused by such errors in official communication.

title: Pahalgam massacre: US tags TRF terror group; recalls Trump‚Äôs 'justice' call
content: The US State Department has declared The Resistance Front (TRF) a foreign terrorist group. This action follows TRF's claim of responsibility for the Pahalgam massacre. The US also linked TRF to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT). Investigations revealed the Pahalgam attack was a joint operation by Pakistan's ISI and LeT. Pakistani terrorists, led by Sulaiman, executed the killings.

title: Video | Remembering 'Fearless Felix': Watch his historic jump from the edge of space
content: Austrian daredevil Felix Baumgartner, famously known as ‚ÄúFearless Felix,‚Äù who made history with his 2012 stratosphere skydive, tragically passed away in a paragliding accident in Italy at the age of 56. Baumgartner became the first human to break the sound barrier in freefall during the Red Bull Stratos mission.

title: Donald Trump diagnosed with chronic venous insufficiency: How serious is it?
content: Donald Trump has been diagnosed with chronic venous insufficiency (CVI) after experiencing mild swelling in his lower legs, according to the White House. Examinations revealed no evidence of deep vein thrombosis or arterial disease, and lab results were within normal limits. His physician noted no signs of heart failure, renal impairment, or systemic illness.

title: 'No gringo is...': Brazil's Lula slams US president over 50% tariff
content: Brazilian President Lula da Silva has strongly criticized US President Donald Trump's decision to impose a 50% tariff on Brazilian imports, asserting Brazil's sovereignty and rejecting foreign interference. Lula accused US tech firms of spreading misinformation and announced plans to regulate and tax them. The escalating trade dispute has boosted Lula's approval ratings as Brazil considers retaliatory measures.

title: Israel strikes near Syria‚Äôs Sweida, first raid after Syrian troops' withdrawal
content: Israeli strikes targeted areas near Sweida, a Druze-majority city, following the withdrawal of Syrian government forces after clashes with local fighters. These strikes occurred amidst escalating violence, with reports of civilian casualties and humanitarian concerns. Israel asserts its actions aim to protect the Druze minority and prevent hostile forces from establishing a presence near the Golan Heights.

title: British open: Scottie Scheffler makes late push while Rory McIlroy stays close
content: Scottie Scheffler concluded the first day of the 2025 British Open at Royal Portrush just one stroke behind the leaders after a 3-under 68. Rory McIlroy showed composure with a 1-under round, a stark contrast to his previous outing at the same course. Bryson DeChambeau, along with other major stars, faces an uphill battle after a challenging start.

title: ‚ÄòSitaare Zameen Par‚Äô: Aamir Khan starrer maintains steady pace; mints Rs 163 crore
content: Aamir Khan and Genelia D‚ÄôSouza's ‚ÄòSitaare Zameen Par‚Äô has grossed ‚Çπ163.50 Cr in its first 28 days, maintaining a steady pace despite a mid-week drop. The film, directed by RS Prasanna, blends emotions, humour, and a social message, receiving 3.5 stars from Times of India. The movie now faces competition from Mohit Suri‚Äôs ‚ÄòSaiyaara‚Äô.

title: ED raids 14 sites linked to Chhangur Baba in Rs 100cr laundering case
content: Enforcement Directorate raided 14 locations linked to Jamaluddin, also known as Chhangur Baba. The raids occurred in Balrampur, Uttar Pradesh, and Mumbai. The investigation focuses on suspected illegal religious conversions and money laundering. Authorities suspect foreign funding of around Rs 100 crore. Preliminary findings show Rs 68 crore routed through bank accounts. The case involves document forgery as well.

title: Fauja Singh death: Kin of accused visit family; son says ‚Äòhe should‚Äôve stopped, helped‚Äô
content: Relatives of Amritpal Singh Dhillon, arrested for the hit-and-run that killed marathoner Fauja Singh, visited the bereaved family to offer condolences. Amritpal, who works in Canada, claimed ignorance of hitting the legendary runner. Despite his remorse, he failed to take responsibility, fleeing the scene and attempting to remain hidden. Police apprehended him using headlight fragments, CCTV, and witness testimonies.

title: Bihar polls: PAC lens on EC‚Äôs SIR drive, fake ID cards
content: The Public Accounts Committee met to discuss important issues. The SIR exercise in Bihar and official documents were key topics. Concerns arose about ineligible individuals obtaining Aadhaar and voter IDs. Some BJP MPs worried about welfare benefits reaching the wrong people. Suggestions were made to simplify Aadhaar corrections. The committee also addressed difficulties faced by Aadhaar cardholders with errors.

title: Trump diagnosed with chronic venous insufficiency: White House confirms
content: Amid speculations about President Trump's bruised hand, the White House disclosed a diagnosis of a chronic, benign vein condition discovered during an examination for swollen legs. Spokesperson Karoline Leavitt attributed hand bruising to frequent handshaking and aspirin use, dismissing concerns about more serious conditions like deep vein thrombosis or arterial disease.

title: Bryan Braman dies at 38; cancer battle ends life of ex-Eagles LB ‚Äî legacy revealed
content: Bryan Braman, former Eagles linebacker, passed away at 38 after a battle with brain cancer. He was a Super Bowl LII champion. Braman is survived by his two daughters and mother. He fought the disease with surgeries and treatment. The NFL community supported him. Braman's legacy includes his grit and dedication to his family.

title: Luka Doncic might walk from the Los Angeles Lakers. Here's why
content: Luka Doncic's future with the Los Angeles Lakers is uncertain as he approaches a player option in 2025-26. Tension arises from the Lakers' apparent shift towards prioritizing Doncic over LeBron James, potentially alienating the Slovenian star. Concerns grow that the Lakers' treatment of James could impact Doncic's trust and willingness to commit long-term.

title: Now, Beijing supports revival of Russia-India-China troika
content: China has expressed its support for Russia's proposal to revive the Russia-India-China (RIC) troika, a consultative forum for discussing global and regional issues. Moscow is actively negotiating with Beijing and New Delhi for the resumption of RIC. The initiative follows S Jaishankar's visit to China for the SCO foreign ministers meeting, where he met with his Chinese and Russian counterparts.

title: Kerala raises legal toddy alcohol limit
content: A 16-year legal fight over toddy strength concludes. Kerala has increased the permissible alcohol content. The new limit is 8.98%. This replaces the 8.1% cap from 2007. The Supreme Court directed a scientific study. An expert panel reviewed samples. The decision supports the traditional toddy sector. A gazette notification is expected soon.

title: Home remedies that can help in reversing Alopecia or hair loss
content: Experiencing hair thinning? Before expensive treatments, explore gentle home remedies. Coconut oil and onion juice can moisturize the scalp and stimulate follicles. Rosemary oil boosts blood flow, while egg masks strengthen strands. Hibiscus and green tea also offer benefits. Diet, hydration, and stress management are crucial. Consistency is key, but consult a doctor for severe hair loss.

title: Brutality not sole criterion for extreme penalty: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has commuted the death sentences of two convicts, emphasizing that the brutality of a crime cannot be the sole determinant for capital punishment. The court stressed the importance of considering mitigating circumstances such as socio-economic background and psychological state. The convicts will now serve life sentences without the possibility of remission.

title: India tests new weapons system for China border
content: The Indian Army will soon induct two Akash Prime surface-to-air missile regiments, designed for high-altitude air defense along the Chinese border. Successful tests in Ladakh demonstrated the system's ability to destroy aerial targets at 15,000 feet. This induction will significantly boost India's air defense capabilities, especially in high-altitude operational environments.

title: Rain halts Amarnath yatra: Army rescues 500 stranded pilgrims
content: The Amarnath Yatra has been temporarily suspended from Jammu, Pahalgam, and Baltal base camps due to rain-damaged tracks. Repair work is underway, with resumption planned for July 18, weather permitting. This decision follows a pilgrim's death and injuries to three others due to landslides, prompting army rescue efforts for stranded pilgrims. So far, 2.5 lakh pilgrims have visited the shrine.

title: Theft, assault can lead to visa being revoked, warns US embassy
content: The US Embassy in India has cautioned Indian travelers about potential visa revocations for crimes like theft and assault, following a viral video of an Indian woman attempting to shoplift $1,300 worth of goods in the US. The Ministry of External Affairs emphasized the importance of abiding by foreign laws to maintain a positive image abroad.

title: NC slams BJP over Ladakh LG appointment, calls it betrayal of promise
content: National Conference has criticised the central government's decision. The decision involves appointing Bharatiya Janata Party leader Kavinder Gupta as Ladakh's Lieutenant Governor. NC spokesperson Tanvir Sadiq said this move contradicts BJP's claims made during the abrogation of Article 370. He added that the appointment exposes BJP's real motives. BJP welcomed the appointment and felicitated Gupta in Jammu.

title: Voting age to be lowered to 16 across UK: Government
content: The UK government has confirmed lowering the voting age to 16 for all UK elections, aligning with Scotland and Wales, potentially adding 1.5 million young voters. Alongside this, British voters can now use UK-issued bank cards as voter ID, and stricter measures will be implemented to combat foreign donations and protect candidates from harassment.

title: ED chargesheet against Robert Vadra in Gurgaon land case
content: The ED filed a chargesheet against Robert Vadra, Sonia Gandhi's son-in-law, accusing him of laundering proceeds from a Gurgaon land deal worth over Rs 58 crore. Vadra and 11 others are implicated in the case, involving Onkareshwar Properties. Vadra's office claims a political witch hunt, vowing to defend against the charges.

title: Former Ulfa deputy chief, Assam‚Äôs AAP ex-chief join BJP
content: In a move anticipated to bolster the BJP's prospects ahead of the 2026 assembly elections, former Ulfa deputy commander-in-chief Drishti Rajkhowa and AAP's Assam unit ex-president Manoj Dhanowar have joined the party.

title: Passan: Inside the first swing-off in MLB All-Star Game history
content: On a night full of firsts, none resonated as much as the finale -- and Kyle Schwarber's titanic performance.

title: Should we have been surprised? A look back at the season's first-half predictions
content: How good is our crystal ball? Before the season's second half gets underway, let's see how our first-half predictions panned out.

title: Waiver wire: Start the second half strong with these pickups
content: As the season's second half gets ready to begin, here are the players you should claim off the waiver wire.

title: Top Georgia high school hoopers since 2000 : Who earned the crown?
content: As part of SportsCenter's "50 States in 50 Days" tour, we're spotlighting the top boys and girls hoopers to come out of Georgia based on high school career achievements.

title: Where do Taylor and Serrano land after all-women card?
content: Lots of movement after a boxing card with 17 titles on the line. Here's the latest women's pound-for-pound rankings.

title: Steve Caballero on how Tony Hawk's Pro-Skater pushed skateboarding to innovate
content: Steve Caballero has been skating since he was 12, and he's been thrilled to see the scene grow alongside Tony Hawk's Pro Skater.

title: Indian-Origin Businessman, 3 Police Chiefs Charged With US Visa Fraud
content: An Indian-origin businessman and the police chiefs of three cities in the US have been charged with visa fraud, allegedly by exploiting a provision to help crime victims.

title: Raids At Bhupesh Baghel's Home In Connection With Case Against Son
content: Enforcement Directorate today launched fresh raids at the premises of former Chhattisgarh chief minister Bhupesh Baghel's son Chaitanya Baghel in connection with a money laundering probe against him linked to an alleged liquor scam, officials said.

title: Court Junks FIR Against 70 Who Hosted Tablighi Jamaat Attendees During Covid
content: The Delhi High Court on Thursday quashed 16 cases against 70 Indian nationals for housing foreign attendees of Tablighi Jamaat congregation in March 2020 allegedly in violation of COVID-19 norms.

title: Trump Calls Purported Letter To Epstein As "Fake", Threatens To Sue WSJ
content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday threatened to sue The Wall Street Journal after it published a story about an alleged off-color letter written by him to late disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein that featured a drawing of a naked woman.

title: Judge In Cash Row Goes To Top Court Over Ex-Chief Justice's Impeachment Plan
content: Allahabad High Court Judge Justice Yashwant Varma, who is at the centre of a controversy over the alleged recovery of a huge amount of cash at his official bungalow, has challenged an in-house inquiry report that recommended his impeachment.

title: "Unacceptable Blackmail": Brazil's Lula Slams Trump's 50% Tariff Threat
content: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva on Thursday slammed Donald Trump's threat to impose 50 percent tariffs on Latin America's largest economy as "unacceptable blackmail."

title: US Designates Group Behind Pahalgam Attack 'Foreign Terrorist Organisation'
content: The US designated The Resistance Front, an offshoot of the Pakistani terrorist group Lashkar-e-Taiba, as a "foreign terrorist organisation" over the April 22 Pahalgam attack.

title: "Not Scheduled At This Time": US Dismisses Reports On Trump's Pak Visit
content: The White House on Friday shunned media reports circling around US President Donald Trump's visit to Pakistan, stating that there has been no such presidential travel plans.

title: Will Scrap SC Certificates Of All Other Than Hindus, Buddhists, Sikhs: Devendra Fadnavis
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Thursday said if a person belonging a religion other than Hinduism, Buddhism and Sikhism has obtained a Scheduled Caste certificate fraudulently, it will be cancelled.

title: US House Passes Landmark Crypto Measures In Win For Trump
content: The US House of Representatives on Thursday passed three landmark cryptocurrency bills, fulfilling the Trump administration's commitment to the once-controversial industry.

title: "Will Drag You To Court": KTR Warns Revanth Reddy Over Drug Allegations
content: Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) working president K. T. Rama Rao on Thursday said he would drag Telangana Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy for the allegations linking him to drugs case.

title: Trump Won't Recommend Special Counsel In Epstein Probe: White House
content: President Donald Trump will not recommend a special counsel in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, a White House spokeswoman said Thursday.

title: 14 Disputed Border Villages In Chandrapur To Be Merged With Maharashtra
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, on Wednesday, directed the inclusion of 14 disputed villages from Jiwati tehsil of Chandrapur district into the state, with a final decision expected soon.

title: Won't Take Orders From "Gringo": Brazil's Lula Slams Trump Amid Tariff Row
content: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva on Thursday said that he would not take orders from a "gringo," responding to U.S. President Donald Trump's letter slapping Brazil with 50% tariffs.

title: Strike On Gaza's Only Church "A Mistake", Netanyahu Tells Trump
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told US President Donald Trump on Thursday that a strike on Gaza's only Catholic church had been "a mistake," the White House said.

title: Trump Diagnosed With Vein Condition Causing Leg Swelling: White House
content: U.S. President Donald Trump has been diagnosed with a "common" vein condition after being evaluated by his doctor over swelling in his lower legs, the White House said on Thursday.

title: Himachal Court Directs State To Remove Encroachments On All Forest Land
content: Himachal Pradesh High Court has directed the state government to remove encroachments on forest lands, including the fruit-bearing trees, all across the state and not limit it to some areas.

title: Pet Owner Shoots At Man After Argument Over Dog In UP, Case Filed: Cops
content: A case has been filed against a pet owner after he shot a man on his leg over an argument over walking his dog without a leash at a village here, police said on Thursday.

title: Media Watchdog Calls Out Trump For "Authoritarian" Attacks On Media
content: In the six months since his return to the White House, Reporters Without Borders said Trump had used "lawfare" and economic pressure on newsrooms, dismantled public media and banned outlets and undesirable wording.

title: 'Historical Trend': Bihar Top Cop On Remark Linking 'Idle' Farmers To Crime
content: Crime data in Bihar has apparently shown a curious trend -- that it spikes in summer and drops once the monsoon hits. The state police have a curious explanation for it.

title: Centre to roll out special programme for remediation of 44% of legacy waste within a year

title: Explain med consent bar on same-sex people: Delhi HC
content: As legal editor for Delhi, Abhinav Garg handles coverage of courts and connected legal challenges shaping the capital. From breaking down complex law related jargon to simplifying how a particular verdict or development in courts may impact the readers, Abhinav brings with him over two decades of experience in the field. title: Bombay HC blocks US child‚Äôs adoption by Indian Muslim couple, cites JJ Act
content:
Rosy Sequeira is special correspondent at The TImes of India, Mumbai
since July 2011. She has covered Bombay High Court for over nine years
which includes her earlier stints with other newspapers. Her forte is
on-the-spot accurate reporting. She tries to bring a human face to the otherwise largely
drab court proceedings and constantly looks out for judicial observations 
that strike a chord with the common man.

title: Power Rankings heading into Week 8: Outlaws lead the way
content: the outlaws face the Whipsnakes on saturday night . a goal from jared Bernhardt is the goalkeeper for the Outlaws . the team will be in action for Indigenous Weekend on friday and Saturday .

title: Fresh threads alert: NFL uniforms get an offseason glow up
content: the new "Charger Power" uniforms will be unveiled in the 2025 offseason . the new uniforms are a popular choice for the Chargers and the los Angeles chargers . they will return their jerseys and pants to their style before they changed their name .

title: Is fighting at home in New Orleans an advantage for Dustin Poirier at UFC 318?
content: Dustin Poirier chose Max Holloway to be his final opponent . he was a lightweight, his natural weight class, after cutting an extra 10 pounds to featherweight . poirier derived his most palpable jubilation that night from what he said to him immediately after the fight .

title: The Next Episode: Snoop invests in Swansea City
content: the former premier league club didn't disclose financial details in the announcement . the rapper and entertainment icon helped launch the team's 2025-26 home shirt last weekend . he also took a playful jab at owner Ryan Reynolds during the launch .

title: How Gavin McKenna's Penn State commitment shifted the NHL prospect landscape
content: Gavin McKenna is a young offensive star for the NHL to market . he amassed 129 points in 56 games with the Medicine Hat Tigers last season . the 17-year-old phenom could have remained in the CHL for another year .

title: Joel Embiid sees you
content: Kendrick Perkins: Embiid feels pressured to play through injury showcases trust issues . he says he's leaning back on a couch that seemed spacious until he eased his long body onto it . his son, Arthur, peeks around corners from the hallway to see what we're up to .

title: Full list of every ESPYS 2025 Award winner
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One celebrates the greatest athletes and moments in sports . the show is underway on ABC and ESPN+ . find out who won here . click here for all the latest capital one news .

title: Evolution of WNBA All-Star Game uniforms
content: the 2025 WNBA All-Star Game reaches its 26-year milestone this weekend . caitlin Clark and Napheesa Collier are team captains after finishing as the top two fan vote-getters . each of them drafted their respective team on July 8 setting the stage for a matchup .

title: Why Arsenal broke the women's transfer record to sign Smith from Liverpool
content: the 20-year-old is the first woman to break the ¬£1 million barrier . she surpasses the previous record set by Chelsea's ¬£900,000 ($1.1 million) transfer of defender Naomi Girma . the gunners have added another player to their ranks since winning the UEFA Women's Champions League in may .

title: Sights and sounds from the first round of the Open Championship
content: the 153rd Open Championship has started at royal portrush golf course in northern Ireland . Xander Schauffele looks to defend his 2024 championship, but it'sn't the source of fulfillment in his life . the crowd enjoyed a chip-in on the 3rd for birdie .

title: The 20 most interesting storylines at NFL training camps
content: christmas is in December, is four weeks long and comes with a present nearly every single day . it's just around the corner, with veteran players for the Chargers and Lions reporting to camp . there's little I look forward to more than the first video to hit my timeline .

title: ED conducts fresh raids at ex-Chhattisgarh CM Baghel's home in liquor scam case against son
content: The house that the father and son share was raided by the ED under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) following receipt of fresh evidence in the case

title: A military expedition to the¬†Gangetic¬† plains that inspired a¬†Chola¬†capital
content: During the expedition,¬†Rajendra¬†Chola¬†I defeated several kings and chieftains. The king celebrated the victory by assuming the title ‚ÄòGangaikonda¬†Cholan‚Äô.¬†He also built¬†Gangaikonda¬† Cholapuram¬†in the present-day¬†Ariyalur¬†district, along with the¬†Gangaikonda¬†Cholisvaram, the Shiva temple that was the jewel in his crown

title: The copper chronicles that detail the reign and deeds of¬†Rajendra¬†Chola¬†I
content: Among the most valuable records from¬†Rajendra‚Äôs¬†time are four sets of copper plate inscriptions discovered at different locations.¬†The¬†Tiruvalangadu¬†Copper Plates, the¬†Karanthai¬†Copper Plates, the¬†Tirukkalar¬†Copper Plates, and the¬†Esalam¬†Copper Plates highlight the¬†Chola¬†lineage, temple endowments, and military expeditions

title: Chola Gangam: A symbol of victory lies in ruins
content: Near¬†Brihadisvara¬†Temple lies¬†Chola¬†Gangam, a tank spread over 17 km. It had once occupied 16 miles.¬†Prime Minister¬†Narendra¬† Modi‚Äôs¬†proposed visit on July 27 and the plan to release a commemorative coin will likely spotlight the condition of the tank¬†

title: Three-storey building collapses in Bandra east; seven injured
content: Teams from Mumbai Fire Brigade (MFB Level-II), BMC, Police, MHADA, PWD, Adani, and other civic agencies have been mobilised

title: Over 5 lakh applications received so far for 35,726 teacher posts in Bengal schools: WBSSC
content: Notification for fresh recruitment was issued on May 30 in adherence to a directive by the Supreme Court

title: For every child free for adoption in India, 13 parents wait in line: Data
content: The average delay for prospective parents to get an adoption referral in India has increased to over three years

title: Budameru floods: a trauma that refuses to subside
content: In August 2024, Budameru floods wreaked havoc on Vijayawada, submerging homes and taking lives. A year into the disaster, residents continue to grapple with loss and a lingering dread for another deluge. Nellore Sravani speaks to the people who are limping back to normalcy and finds out the status of an ambitious project aimed at ending the generational trauma

title: Bringing a ‚Äòghost river‚Äô back to life
content: The Karnataka government has announced its ambitious plan to bring the Arkavati back to life, but people living close to the river have little hope, while experts point out to many challenges, writes K.C. Deepika.

title: Piracy, the unwritten villain of Telugu films
content: Before the first weekend of a new theatrical release ends, entire films are pirated and posted online, leaving Telugu cinema wide open to digital loot. With losses estimated at ‚Çπ3,700 crore in 2024, the industry is shifting from damage control to decisive action through police arrests, court orders and digital tracking. From cam prints to crypto deals, the network is organised, but with enforcement intensifying, there is hope that the plot is slowly but surely turning. A report by Sangeetha Devi Dundoo

title: India will leverage AI to lead global creative economy: I&B Secretary Sanjay Jaju
content: India‚Äôs leading AI startups were urged to develop indigenous, scalable solutions that reflect the linguistic and cultural diversity of the nation

title: CPI(M)‚Äôs Md Salim says SIR Electoral Roll revision will target marginalised people and strip democratic rights
content: ‚ÄúThis attack on Bengalis across the country is an attack on the diversity, democracy, and unity of our country,‚Äù Mr Salim

title: Raziyya Sultan, Nur Jehan dropped from new Class 8 NCERT history textbook
content: References to Tipu Sultan, Haidar Ali, four Anglo-Mysore wars removed, while sections related to Anglo-Maratha wars retained

title: CARA asks State adoption agencies to strengthen counselling process
content: This initiative aims to reinforce the psychosocial support framework for all key stakeholders ‚Äî prospective adoptive parents, adopted children, and biological parents who surrender their child for adoption

title: Task force wants Andhra Pradesh to take a cue from States like Tamil Nadu to tap potential of blue economy  ¬†
content: It has also suggested to the government to develop a hi-tech city along the proposed ring road around Amaravati, covering AI, semiconductors and other industrial hubs

title: West Bengal finally asks its colleges to follow HC order by shutting down students‚Äô union rooms
content: West Bengal colleges ordered to lock students‚Äô union rooms following Calcutta High Court directive for campus safety

title: Operation Sindoor delivered a strong message on security: Amit Shah
content: Mr. Shah said, the vision of a prosperous and secure nation had been turned into a reality under the present dispensation

title: Odisha college girl death: Flames of protest singe the system
content: After a 20-year-old student set herself ablaze on a college campus in Odisha due to alleged denial of justice in a sexual harassment complaint filed against her teacher, the State machinery swung into action. The President visited the hospital when the woman was on ventilator, students protested, and top doctors paid close attention to her.¬†Satyasundar Barik¬†reports on her death, her family‚Äôs shock, and the political panic that followed

title: Form SIT to probe tax scam in Madurai Corporation: High Court
content: The judges direct the Inspector-General of Police (South Zone) and the Madurai Commissioner of Police to constitute the team, headed by a senior IPS officer with proven integrity

title: U.P. DGP says 238 criminals have been killed and 9,467 shot in leg in 14,973 encounters since 2017
content: The force has ensured an ‚Äúaggressive crackdown on crime‚Äù under the Chief Minister‚Äôs directions, the DGP added.

title: HC tells W.B. to file affidavit on resuming student union polls
content: Student union elections came to a halt across higher education institutions a little before the Covid-19 pandemic in 2020

title: Dharmasthala burials case: Former SC Judge demands SIT probe monitored by a sitting or retired HC/SC Judge
content: Police are allegedly coercing him to mark the places he has buried the bodies on a white paper. Also, the statement of the whistleblower is being leaked to private individuals: V. Gopala Gowda

title: A day after Gopalganj clashes, India reiterates call for Bangladesh election ‚Äòwith everybody in its fold‚Äô
content: The clashes in Gopalganj occurred after NCP leaders arrived outside the memorial of Sheikh Mujib, which is guarded by Awami League activists

title: The parameters of ‚Äòsuccess‚Äô in Bihar‚Äôs poll roll revision
content: It remains to be seen whether the Election Commission of India is able to ensure a fair exercise of verification in Bihar

title: India warns against ‚Äòdouble standards‚Äô over Russian oil
content: The Ministry of External Affairs responds to U.S. Congress Bill mandating 500% duties on countries buying Russian oil; NATO chief threatens India, China, Brazil, top buyers of Russian products, but EU also buys Russian oil

title: Thalassemia patients call for standardised tests to reduce transfusion-transmitted infections¬†
content: At present, Nucleic Acid Testing (NAT), a highly sensitive molecular technique used to screen blood donations for infectious diseases, is used in some hospitals

title: POSH Act application to be extended to TV serial sector soon: WCD Director
content: Attention will also be given to applicability of POSH Act in the gig sector, she says at seminar on strengthening institutional mechanisms combating violence against women and girls

title: I&B Secretary urges AI startups to shape solutions for bridging linguistic divides
content: Invites them to participate in Kalaa Setu, Bhasha Setu challenges on WaveX Startup Accelerator Platform¬†

title: Vijayawada receives top award for cleanliness despite 2024 floods
content: To qualify for the ‚ÄòSuper Swachh League‚Äô award, a city must rank in the top three positions at least once in the last three years and must stay in the top 20 positions till 2024, says Vijayawada Municipal Corporation Commissioner

title: Bombay High Court upholds constitutional validity of UAPA, rejects sedition challenge¬†
content: Anil Baburao Baile‚Äôs petition questioned the constitutional validity of UAPA and sedition law provisions; court found no merit in the arguments raised by the Elgaar Parishad case accused

title: Congress to organise protest at Parliament demanding Statehood for Jammu and Kashmir
content: The Jammu and Kashmir unit of the party said the message would next be taken via the ‚ÄòChalo Delhi Chalo‚Äô campaign on July 21

title: CBFC assures Bombay High Court of decision on certification for film on Yogi Adityanath in two working days
content: Scheduled for theatrical release on August 1, the film ‚ÄòAjey: The Untold Story of a Yogi‚Äô draws inspiration from the book ‚ÄòThe Monk Who Became Chief Minister‚Äô and is said to depict the life of Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath

title: Plea in Supreme Court says Bhopal gas victims have been ‚Äòmisclassified‚Äô
content: The plea claims that survivors with lasting, severe injuries and illnesses have been wrongly classified under ‚Äòtemporary disablement‚Äô and ‚Äòminor injury‚Äô and under-compensated for years

title: Commuters flag lack of transparency in auto, cab fares on aggregator apps¬†
content: Commuters argue that aggregator apps charge significantly higher than the meter fare, often due to vague policies like ‚Äòtips‚Äô, ‚Äòcongestion fee‚Äô, ‚Äòplatform fees‚Äô, ‚Äòdriver addition‚Äô etc

title: Indian Navy‚Äôs eastern fleet ships reach Singapore to bolster naval ties in Southeast Asia
content: Indian Navy and Republic of Singapore Navy share operational relations spanning over three decades of cooperation

title: Andhra Pradesh to see fairly widespread rainfall till July 24
content: State records 38% deficit rainfall since arrival of monsoon, with the exception of six districts which received normal rainfall; four districts record a large shortfall

title: Drift in India‚Äôs foreign policy a matter of serious concern; time for course correction: Congress
content: Opposition party flags the matter of India abstaining on the UN Resolution on Gaza ceasefire, and Indo-U.S. trade deal as key concerns

title: Karnataka government decides to undo denotification
content: Despite the rule, denotification was taken up, which is illegal. Action will be initiated against officials who were responsible for the illegal act: H.K. Patil

title: Rahul Gandhi to inaugurate second death anniversary of Oommen Chandy
content: The visit is anticipated to significantly energise Congress party‚Äôs rank and file ahead of the local body elections later this year and the Assembly elections next year

title: CISF trains with Army to combat security threats

title: Amrabad now has 36 tigers
content: The monitoring for the previous year estimated the tiger population at 33; a total of 1,594 camera traps were in place in the reserve between December 20, 2024 and May 15, 2025
